metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11690 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
gen_rand_uuid in lib/uuid.c in Das U-Boot v2014.04 through v2019.04 lacks an srand call, which allows attackers to determine UUID values in scenarios where CONFIG_RANDOM_UUID is enabled, and Das U-Boot is relied upon for UUID values of a GUID Partition Table of a boot device.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11690` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

u-boot - 2019.07+dfsg-1ubuntu4~18.04.1
u-boot-amlogic - 2019.07+dfsg-1ubuntu4~18.04.1
u-boot-exynos - 2019.07+dfsg-1ubuntu4~18.04.1
u-boot-imx - 2019.07+dfsg-1ubuntu4~18.04.1
u-boot-omap - 2019.07+dfsg-1ubuntu4~18.04.1
u-boot-qcom - 2019.07+dfsg-1ubuntu4~18.04.1
u-boot-rockchip - 2019.07+dfsg-1ubuntu4~18.04.1
u-boot-rpi - 2019.07+dfsg-1ubuntu4~18.04.1
u-boot-sunxi - 2019.07+dfsg-1ubuntu4~18.04.1
u-boot-tegra - 2019.07+dfsg-1ubuntu4~18.04.1
u-boot-tools - 2019.07+dfsg-1ubuntu4~18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: u-boot package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2019.07+dfsg-1ubuntu4~18.04.1').
